body_html:
A few things:

(a) You mention "google protobuf", but it seems you're talking about TensorFlow and not protobuf? Or is there something about protobuf that I'm missing?

(b) Does python -c "from google.cloud import logging as gclogging;" succeed if you do not install TensorFlow?

(c) I'm not sure how source installations interact, but can you pip install google-cloud (from https://google-cloud-python.readthedocs.io/en/stable/#) instead of installing google-cloud from sources. Does that work?
body_text:
A few things:
(a) You mention "google protobuf", but it seems you're talking about TensorFlow and not protobuf? Or is there something about protobuf that I'm missing?
(b) Does python -c "from google.cloud import logging as gclogging;" succeed if you do not install TensorFlow?
(c) I'm not sure how source installations interact, but can you pip install google-cloud (from https://google-cloud-python.readthedocs.io/en/stable/#) instead of installing google-cloud from sources. Does that work?
body:
A few things:

(a) You mention "google protobuf", but it seems you're talking about TensorFlow and not protobuf? Or is there something about protobuf that I'm missing?

(b) Does `python -c "from google.cloud import logging as gclogging;"` succeed if you do not install TensorFlow?

(c) I'm not sure how source installations interact, but can you `pip install google-cloud` (from https://google-cloud-python.readthedocs.io/en/stable/#) instead of installing `google-cloud` from sources. Does that work?
